section.p: The video module is disabled by default. You need to call this method to enable it. To disable the video module later, call the method.
The video module is disabled by default and needs to be enabled by calling this method. To disable the video module later, call the method.
The video module is disabled by default. You need to call this method to enable it. To disable the video module later, call the method.
The video module is disabled by default and must be enabled by calling this method. To disable the video module later, call the method.

ul.li: This method sets the internal engine to an enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.

Calling this method resets the entire engine and has a relatively slow response time. Depending on your needs, you can use the following methods to control specific video module features independently:
: Whether to start the camera capture and create a local video stream.
: Whether to publish the local video stream.
: Whether to receive and play the remote video stream.
: Whether to receive and play all remote video streams.
When this method is called in a channel, it resets the settings of , , and , so use with caution.
This method sets the internal engine to the enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.

Calling this method resets the entire engine and has a relatively slow response time. Depending on your needs, you can use the following methods to independently control specific video module functions:
: Whether to start camera capture and create a local video stream.
: Whether to publish the local video stream.
: Whether to receive and play remote video streams.
: Whether to receive and play all remote video streams.
When called in a channel, this method resets the settings of , , and , so use with caution.
This method sets the internal engine to an enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.

Calling this method resets the entire engine and may take longer to respond. You can use the following methods to control specific video functions as needed:
: Whether to enable camera capture and create the local video stream.
: Whether to publish the local video stream.
: Whether to receive and play the remote video stream.
: Whether to receive and play all remote video streams.
When called in a channel, this method resets the settings of , , and . Use with caution.
This method sets the internal engine to an enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.

Calling this method resets the entire engine, which may result in a slower response. You can use the following methods to independently control specific video module features as needed:
: Whether to start camera capture and create a local video stream.
: Whether to publish the local video stream.
: Whether to receive and play the remote video stream.
: Whether to receive and play all remote video streams.
When this method is called in a channel, it resets the settings of , , and , so use with caution.

section.title: Timing
section.p:
This method can be called before or during a channel:
If called before joining a channel, the video module is enabled.
If called during an audio-only call, it automatically switches to a video call.

This method can be called before or during a channel:
If called before joining a channel, it enables the video module.
If called during an audio-only call, the call automatically switches to a video call.

This method can be called before or during a channel:
If called before joining, the video module is enabled.
If called during an audio-only call, the call automatically switches to a video call.

This method can be called before or after joining a channel:
If called before joining a channel, the video module is enabled.
If called during an audio-only call, the call automatically switches to a video call.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After this method is successfully called, the remote user receives the callback.
After successfully calling this method, the remote side triggers the callback.
After this method is successfully called, the remote side receives the callback.
After this method is called successfully, the remote side triggers the callback.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting tips.
< 0: Method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
